canal

Class Canal

  • java.lang.Object
    • canal.Canal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CaptorAsync, ObsCaptorAsync, Observer<Diffusion>, Subject<ObsCaptor>

    public class Canal
extends java.lang.Object
implements ObsCaptorAsync, CaptorAsync
    Canal is implementing all proxy interfaces. It is managing all interactions with the mScheduler and the creation of callables.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private CaptorState mCaptorState
      The CaptorState which contains the mCaptorState
      private java.util.List<ObsCaptor> mObservers
      List of observers
      private SchedulerMonitor mScheduler
      Scheduler which will manage callables that the canal creates.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void> update(CaptorState c)
        update creates the update callable and call scheduleUpdate to return a future to caller. It also keeps a reference on the state in order to return it when observers will ask for the state.
        Specified by:
        update in interface ObsCaptorAsync
        Parameters:
        c - is the current state of CaptorOriginator when the diffusion execution method is called
        Returns:
        a Future without result

      • getValue

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer> getValue()
        getValue creates the getValue callable and call scheduleUpdate to return a future to caller
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface CaptorAsync
        Returns:
        a Future which will contain the state of CaptorMonitor according to its diffusion
